subject: Programming
title: Mariner 1 and the Missing Hyphen
description: Learn Mariner 1 and the Missing Hyphen in one minute.

hook.text: In 1962, NASA destroyed a Venus-bound rocket 293 seconds after launch.

buildup.text: Mariner 1 veered off course and had to be self-destructed over the Atlantic.

discovery.text: A missing overbar in a handwritten formula was transcribed wrong into the guidance code.

twist.text: One tiny punctuation mark in the specification caused an $18 million loss.

climax.text: Arthur C. Clarke called it 'the most expensive hyphen in history.'

punchline.text: A missing symbol destroyed a space mission.

quiz.question: What did Arthur C. Clarke call the Mariner 1 failure?
options: The most expensive hyphen in history
